intro: Chesneya ternata, commonly known as the three-leaved chesney, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are arranged in a triangular pattern, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chesneya ternata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access groundwater.
